name: ESSAI 2026
venue: European Summer School on Artificial Intelligence, Vienna, Austria
description: The 2026 European Summer School on Artificial Intelligence (ESSAI) will take place in Vienna, Austria from 6 to 10 July 2026. It is designed for PhD students and young researchers and provides both introductory and advanced AI courses, tutorials, and a rich social program. With over 30 lecturers, parallel tracks, and networking opportunities, participants can gain a broad view of AI and connect with international experts.

name: OpenEuroLLM Winter School
description: The 2026 Winter School on Multilinguality in LLM Development and Evaluation is organized by the Nordic Language Processing Laboratory in collaboration with the OpenEuroLLM project and takes place at the Skeikampen conference hotel north of Oslo, Norway. It targets NLP researchers, especially those from EuroHPC consortium countries and doctoral students, offering in‑depth technical presentations, hands‑on elements and discussions on open science for European languages. The programme includes expert talks, a walk‑through of EuroHPC experience reports, and provides subsidised participation with free bus transfer from Oslo Airport.

name: Probabilistic AI School
description: ProbAI School 2026 is a Probabilistic AI School taking place in Vilnius, Lithuania. It aims to provide an inclusive educational environment featuring state-of-the-art expertise in machine learning and artificial intelligence. The programme welcomes enthusiasts, students, academics, and industry professionals to learn and collaborate.

name: BMVA Computer Vision Summer School
description: The 29th BMVA Computer Vision Summer School will be held at Durham University in Durham, England, UK. It offers an intensive week of lectures and lab sessions covering a wide range of computer‑vision topics, delivered by leading researchers from the UK and abroad. The programme features daily oral talks and hands‑on sessions designed for students and early‑career researchers interested in advancing their skills in computer vision.

name: Oxford Machine Learning Summer School 2026
venue: Oxford ML School, Oxford, United Kingdom
description: OxML Summer 2026 is a programme offered by the Oxford ML School that combines in‑person sessions in Oxford with an online component. It provides three specialised AI tracks taught by world‑renowned experts from leading academic and industry labs, allowing participants to customise their learning path. The school emphasizes cutting‑edge theory and practical applications, with a timeline of key milestones leading up to the event.

name: Robotics, Perception and Learning (RPL) Summer School
venue: KTH Royal Institute of Technology, Stockholm, Sweden
description: The RPL Summer School 2026, organized by the Division for Robotics, Perception and Learning at KTH Royal Institute of Technology in Stockholm, Sweden, targets doctoral and postdoctoral researchers. It covers a broad spectrum of topics such as machine learning, computer vision, robotics, human‑robot interaction, planning and decision making, and combines keynote talks with brainstorming and discussion sessions to foster new collaborations. The six‑day event takes place at the Happy Tammsvik resort, offering participants a relaxed setting with nature, spa facilities and outdoor activities while all accommodation and meals are sponsored.

name: Machine Learning Crash Course at MALGA
description: The MLCC2026 Summer School, a Machine Learning Crash Course, takes place at the University of Genoa’s DIBRIS/DIMA building in Genova, Italy. It offers an introductory, hands‑on program on fundamental machine‑learning concepts and algorithms for undergraduate and graduate students, as well as professionals, with lectures and lab sessions covering topics such as statistical learning, optimization, kernel methods and neural networks. The in‑person course runs from 15 to 19 June 2026, includes a final test and provides university credit, while participants benefit from access to the MaLGa Center facilities and networking opportunities.

name: UK Robotics Summer School
venue: National Robotarium, Heriot-Watt University, Edinburgh, Scotland, UK
description: The UK Robotics Summer School 2026 is a five‑day program held at the National Robotarium, Heriot‑Watt University in Edinburgh, Scotland. It offers expert lectures, tutorials and industry talks covering bio‑inspired robotics, healthcare robotics, generative AI, validation and verification of AI, and real‑world applications. Aimed at master’s‑level students and industry practitioners, the school provides hands‑on experience with state‑of‑the‑art robots and networking opportunities.

name: International Summer School for Advanced Studies on Biometrics, Behavior, and Vision
description: The 2026 Biometrics International Summer School takes place in Alghero, Sardinia, Italy, hosted at the Hotel Dei Pini in Porto Conte. It focuses on the impact of generative AI and large foundation models on biometric and human‑recognition technologies, covering machine learning, image understanding, signal analysis, neuroscience, robotics, forensic and digital forensics. The program is aimed at PhD students, post‑docs, researchers, forensic examiners and professionals, offering intensive lectures by 18 experts, hands‑on sessions, and the possibility of scholarships and a limited‑capacity, in‑person experience.

name: 1st Internationa School on the Cognitive, Ethical, and Societal Dimensions of AI - AIces
description: AIces 2026 is the first International School focusing on the cognitive, ethical and societal dimensions of artificial intelligence. It targets graduate and postgraduate students as well as industry practitioners, offering two parallel courses, face‑to‑face networking and live online participation. All lectures are recorded and available for 45 days after the event, and participants receive a certificate indicating the number of academic hours.

name: Winter School on Ethical, Legal, and Societal (ELS) aspects of AI and AS at Umeå University
description: The Winter School on Ethical, Legal, and Societal aspects of AI and Autonomous Systems brings together researchers and students to explore multidisciplinary challenges of emerging technologies. It offers a program of lectures, hands‑on training, and a poster session, complemented by a social program for networking and professional exchange. The event takes place at Umeå University in Sweden from 11 to 13 March 2026.

name: Winter School on Social Robotics, Artificial Intelligence and Multimedia (SoRAIM 2026)
description: The Winter School on Social Robotics, Artificial Intelligence and Multimedia (SoRAIM'26) will be held at the Escandille in Autrans, France. It aims to bring together researchers from fields such as computer vision, speech/audio processing, and human‑robot interaction to foster cross‑disciplinary exchange through courses and informal networking. The programme features talks by top‑level experts on topics like affective signal processing, conversational speech synthesis, and multi‑modal dialogue, set against the backdrop of the Vercors mountains.

name: Machine Learning Summer School (MLSS) Melbourne
venue: Sandridge Events Centre, Port Melbourne, Melbourne, Australia
description: The 2026 Machine Learning Summer School in Melbourne brings together 50 hand‑picked PhD students and early‑career researchers for a two‑week intensive program. World‑class speakers from academia and industry cover topics ranging from core machine‑learning theory to emerging research beyond large language models. The school is held at the Sandridge Events Centre in Port Melbourne, offering in‑person lectures, tutorials, and networking opportunities.

name: Northern Lights Deep Learning Winter School
venue: UiT The Arctic University of Norway, Tromsø, Norway
description: The 2027 Winter School on Deep Learning is part of the Northern Lights Deep Learning Conference and will be held in Tromsø, Norway. It runs from 12 to 14 January 2027 at UiT The Arctic University of Norway and focuses on state‑of‑the‑art deep‑learning methods such as image classification, object detection, segmentation, time‑series prediction and speech recognition. The school targets researchers and practitioners who want to exchange ideas, foster collaborations and learn about recent advances in the field.

name: Annual Nepal AI School (ANAIS)
description: The Sixth Annual Nepal AI School (ANAIS) is an 11‑day intensive program that offers AI lectures, hands‑on labs, and project work. It covers material from fundamental mathematics and statistics to cutting‑edge applications such as visual recognition, natural language processing, and medical science, targeting senior undergraduates, graduate students, PhD candidates, faculty, and industry professionals. The school brings together more than 500 in‑person participants and thousands of online viewers at Swostishree Gurukul in Kathmandu, Nepal.

name: EEML Summer School
description: The Eastern European Machine Learning Summer School takes place in Cetinje, Montenegro from 27 July to 1 August 2026. It brings together leading researchers from institutions such as Google DeepMind, UC Santa Barbara, and Mila to deliver lectures and tutorials on current machine‑learning topics. The program targets students and early‑career researchers in the region, offering hands‑on sessions, networking opportunities, and exposure to cutting‑edge AI research.

name: Mediterranean Summer School
venue: University of Split Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering and Naval Architecture, Split, Croatia
description: The Mediterranean Machine Learning (M2L) Summer School 2025 offers a focused five‑day program of keynotes, lectures, and practical sessions led by international AI experts. It is aimed at doctoral and outstanding master students, as well as academics and practitioners, with an emphasis on topics such as computer vision, NLP, generative models, and reinforcement learning. The school also promotes networking through poster sessions, cultural activities, and a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion.

name: Summer School on Multimodal Foundation Models and Generative AI
venue: Institut National des Postes et Télécommunications, Rabat, Morocco
description: The AI Summer School on Multimodal Foundation Models and Generative AI is a five‑day immersive program held at the Institut National des Postes et Télécommunications in Rabat, Morocco. It targets young researchers, Ph.D. and master students, post‑docs, and industry professionals, offering theoretical lectures, hands‑on labs, and project mentorship on state‑of‑the‑art multimodal and generative AI techniques. The school features expert instruction from world‑renowned speakers, networking opportunities, and aims to develop the next generation of AI leaders in Morocco.

name: AthNLP Summer School 2026
description: The Athens Natural Language Processing Summer School 2026 will be held at the campus of NCSR Demokritos in Athens, Greece. The program brings together experts from RC Athena, NCSR Demokritos, Athens University of Economics and Business, and Heriot‑Watt University to deliver intensive training in natural language processing. It targets students and researchers interested in advancing their knowledge of NLP through lectures and hands‑on sessions during the week of September 3‑9.

name: Advanced Artificial Intelligence: GenAI & Deep Unsupervised Learning
venue: Lady Margaret Hall, Oxford, United Kingdom
description: The Advanced Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning summer school at Lady Margaret Hall focuses on generative AI and deep unsupervised learning techniques. It offers theoretical foundations and hands‑on experience with clustering, GANs, self‑supervised learning, and other state‑of‑the‑art models across various real‑world domains. The programme is aimed at STEM students with intermediate AI/ML knowledge who are considering graduate study or research.

name: AI4Science Summer School
description: The 2nd Summer School on Advancing Scientific Discovery with AI brings together researchers, PhD students and post‑doctoral scholars in Caen, Normandy, France. It focuses on applying deep‑learning techniques to accelerate scientific research, covering topics such as machine‑learning for data analysis, AI‑driven experimental design, generative models, and integration with physical simulations. The programme combines lectures with hands‑on Python workshops using libraries like NumPy and PyTorch to give participants practical experience in implementing AI models for scientific problems.

name: LUT Summer School
description: LUT Summer School is a one‑week intensive programme at LUT University’s Lappeenranta campus offering courses that blend sustainability, climate action, marketing, management and inventive thinking. The courses are aimed at bachelor’s and master’s students in business and technology and combine classroom workshops, group work and a social programme set in the Finnish summer environment. Participants receive 3 ECTS credits, access to campus facilities and the opportunity to experience Finland’s nature while networking with peers and experts.
